ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the different sustainable development goals. How we can use multiple sectors' expertise to create solutions going into the future. One big takeaway was that too much time is spent talking/discussing/planning when really implementation is the hardest part. This course gave me hope for our future as a society and showed me that it will take considerable effort to fix the current systematic problems we face.
How to conduct my own independent project from its beginning to the implementation phase.

Gained deep insight into a variety of fields working on implementing Sustainable Development Goals all over the world. Gained skills in developing my own project, and providing a plan of how exactly implementation would look like. Gained insight into difficulties that come with implementation.
So much! I learned how to write a project proposal and learned many skills about project management.
Essentially doing a capstone/research project! Super fun.
Learned about green practices in the real world as opposed to theoretical. Also great to network with the speakers.
Life skills, how to plan a business and make a model
Learned a lot about SDGs in actual practice. The course title doesnt lie  the entire class is around your project and speakers that come to talk about real organizations and projects.
I really gained an in-depth understanding of the SDGs and loved doing the personal projects.
Public speaking
I learned about the importance of the UN's sustainable development goals and gained insights from people addressing them in the real world.
Understanding how to develop and pitch a project that has to do with an SDG and hear from great speakers.
We learned a lot about the current efforts to work towards all of the sustainable development goals.
I learned about ways sdgs can be accomplished
Developing our project required me to cold call people, establish connections, and learn how to do efficient and relevant research to inform actually decisions.

I learned a lot about the real world application of the SDGs through different organizations I had never heard of before. I also learned how to craft an implementation plan for a project with a budget and timeline.
I learned how to build a project in accordance to the UN's 17 SDGs.
On sdgs
Learned a lot about various different organizations across the world and how sustainable practices are being implemented differently everywhere.
How to create an implementation plan to achieve sustainable goals, lots of good guests speakers to learn about a variety of sustainable issues in multiple sectors

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The course is almost entirely guest lectures. These are really interesting but it is easy to become disengaged when non of the content is being examined. 
I think having one or two workshops where we learn about planning or implementation strategies would have been good.

Strengths: the guest speakers were great, I really enjoyed working on the independent project since it gave a lot of freedom to students to allocate their time however needed 
Weakness: none
So many strengths! No weaknesses.
it was the best course ive taken
Overall a relaxed class with the project being something that I was genuinely excited to work on. Nothing to complain about here
The guest lectures are so cool! It's such a unique class given that it's mostly guest lectures.
The course benefitted from an enthusiastic teaching staff and interesting material, but it could have been improved with more of a focus on sustainability related SDGs.
I think not every class should be a speaker and some foundational knowledge on sdgs
I really enjoyed the variety of guest lecturers and topics.
More structure instead of just examples but that also might be the appeal of the course
They need a stronger attendance policy, I wish I showed up more, and I felt like I needed a little nudge

Strengths: Very engaging, diverse, and impressive guest lecturers. I was exposed to topics/orgs I had never heard of and will never forget.

Weaknesses: Very little engagement with the professor and TAs. I wish we could have dedicated at least half a lecture on each of them and what they have accomplished.

This course has incredible guest speakers. However, it often felt dragged out and might have been better suited as a 50 min lecture. Sometimes, the grading felt opinion based rather than rubric based. The rubric for assignments was often released very late and was rather unclear.
None
Loved the diverse speakers that came to talk to us!
Flexibility of projects, guest speakers, and TFs are strengths, no weaknesses

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes Yes Yes. If you are interested in the challenge that climate change is causing, or any world injustice then this course gives you the time to research further and create plans to fix it. If you have any passion and want Yale credit to research it, this is a great course. Moreover, there are always cool and interesting grad students in the class who bring a unique insight into the field.

Yes! If you want to do something really creative and step out from your comfort zone do it! It's a course that is meant to empower you to be sort of an entrepreneur/leader of a project and you can learn so much out of it.

Yes - highly recommend this course! No matter what major or field you plan to work in, Sustainable Development Goals are related in some way. Hearing about other peoples' work and creating an independent project really helps you develop valuable skills and knowledge.
Yes!
Yes! It is a super interesting course. You get to listen to different speakers throughout the semester and then complete a project based on your choosing.

Yes! Amazing speakers and leaders from environmental/conservation fields around the world, which is a great networking opportunity. Amazing course where you are given the opportunity to propose and implement your own projects of your own passion.
Yes, great way to learn how to take initiative on a project and flesh out ideas.

Yes!! If you want a chill class and also give a shot at designing a project to solve a problem you care about, this is definitely for you. The class is just speakers and deliverables include stuff for your project and discussion posts for the speakers.
Yes! Such a fun cool course.

Yes; it is a great class that centers around building a project of your own that targets the SDGs. Lots of freedom to make actual impact, and the guest lectures are very interesting and a great way to connect with leaders in the field. Could use more feedback, especially on the midterm (which is a progress report on the project). Professor Geballe is very nice and helpful.
Yes, I'd recommend this class to anyone curious as to how these problems are being tackled in practice.
Yes if they are interested in sdgs
YES
Yes - it is a course very much grounded in real life applications.
No unless there is a project you are interested in implementing, dont take it. I thought I would learn more concrete things but instead it was like an open lab workshop
Yes, it was a blast and each lecture provided a new perspective on potential carrears and interesting paths to take out of college

Definitely! It is very low pressure, purely designed for student engagement with diff. orgs and networking with impressive and accomplished individuals that might work in an organization or field you are interested in interning at.
Yes, the material is very cool but the organization of the class is very low.
Yes
YES! Such an amazing course to develop a real action plan to take steps for a more sustainable future!

Yes, I learned a lot about sustainable development goals through the guest speakers and learned a lot about the factors involved in implementation through my final project. It was really cool to meet so many different people who carry out the SDGs differently through their work. It was inspiring
